title: How was this goal allowed? Leyton Orient fans left fuming after Plymouth player PUNCHES ball
text:
Leyton Orient were left absolutely seething during their hammering at Plymouth on Tuesday night.

Plymouth thrashed Orient 4-0 during the League Two encounter at Home Park but the hosts' opening goal was met by somewhat more than a hint of controversy.

With just 14 minutes into the fixture, Orient goalkeeper Dean Brill produced an acrobatic save to deny a powerful header.

Zak Rudden punches the ball towards goal with his hand against Leyton Orient on Tuesday

Orient goalkeeper Dean Brill made the save but then Joel Grant struck home on the follow up

😲 How on earth was handball not given in the build up to this goal?! No wonder Leyton Orient feel aggrieved...#LOFC pic.twitter.com/SKJG51CzsV — Sporting Life Football (@SportingLifeFC) October 23, 2019

The ball then bounced straight into the path of Plymouth striker Zak Rudden - on loan from Scottish giants Rangers - who messed up his jump before blatantly smashing the ball towards goal with his right hand.

Brill somehow made an excellent save to deny Rudden but he couldn't do anything more as Joel Grant followed in on the rebound to fire into the top of the net.

The visitors were rightly left fuming that the clearly intentional handball was not spotted by referee Craig Hicks and his assistants.

Orient's Twitter account posted this just moments after going controversially behind

This Orient supporter certainly wasn't happy with the decision: 'Shocking refereeing'

This fan couldn't believe what he had just seen, labelling one of the worst decisions ever

And Orient failed to recover from the early referee howler as they went on to concede three more goals before the close of play.

Following the incident, Orient supporters took to social media to vent their frustration, with one fan saying: 'The most clear as day hand ball you'll ever see! Shocking refereeing.'

Another Orient fan slammed: 'That's ridiculous from the ref, sack him', while another tweeted: 'Thought we'd left crap refs behind.'

And finally, one fan said: 'I'm in shock what on earth have I just seen. The referee should have every single qualification or license he has taken away, that is without doubt one of THE WORST footballing decisions ever.'

This fan called for the referee to be sacked during the League Two encounter on Tuesday

The frustration kept flooding in on Twitter following the hugely controversial opener
description: Plymouth thrashed Orient 4-0 during the League Two encounter at Home Park but the hosts' opening goal was met by somewhat more than a hint of controversy.
